text:
Improvement Pill here – here's an idea that's 
made me into a much happier person these

past few months. It's going to sound a bit 
crazy – ok? What if you and I are the same.

And I don't mean like we're both 
human. Or that we like the same things.

I mean what if you and I are literally 
the same being. The same soul.

You see - there are stories of people that had 
traumatic brain injuries like a getting a rod

shot through their head which lead to 
sudden changes in the way they act,

someone who used to be calm and collected 
would suddenly become someone who was easily

irritated and upset. So it seems like 
a lot of what we feel is tied to whats

physically going on in our body and 
brain. So we are not what we feel.

Then there are stories of twins and triplets who 
were separated at birth but eventually reunited.

Only to find out that all 3 smoke the same type 
of cigarettes, all 3 like older women, and all 3

even dance the same way. Which means that a lot 
of what we think makes us special, our unique

preferences in life, our quirks, how we act - 
might actually be because of our genes – our DNA.
This made me think – what if who we think we are,

is actually just a list of traits and emotions 
for the physical body that we are currently in.

All of the things that we identify with, our 
age, our race, our height, the way we look,

the way we feel, our positives and negatives: 
all of this - are just labels and personality

traits of a character in a movie. This ain't the 
real you. The real you is the being on the couch

watching this movie. Some call it your 
consciousness, others call it your soul.
Now stay with me,

Here's another idea that I've been thinking 
about a lot which comes from the Egg Story – by

Andy Weir. Kursegatz also made a video 
about it. To quickly sum it up – the

main character dies and is told that when you 
die, you get reincarnated into another body.

You might come back as some random 
person on the other side of the world.

You might even come back as a dog. Every 
time you die this cycle continues on and

on until you've experienced every single 
life that exists, and will ever exist.

This idea of reincarnation - kinda make senses 
to me because there are interesting studies of

kids under the age of 5 who have strange memories 
of past lives. There are thousands of cases where

kids are able to remember exactly how and where 
someone else died, along with dozens of other

small details about that persons life. And just 
to be clear this is all before the internet so

how would a 5 year old kid in some Indian 
village know how someone died in France,

a country that uses a totally different 
language? Researchers ended up concluding

that somethings definitely going on here, could it 
be reincarnation? Who knows – they can't prove it.

But lets run with these 2 ideas - what if 
everything we identify with is actually just

part of the body that we're currently in. 
And the real us is this being on the couch.

AND what if every time we die – the movie 
finishes – and we flip the channel to

the next movie. If this is true, then 
it's possible that we are all the same

being just at different stages of 
it's movie binge-watching journey.

It's possible that you and I are the same. 
One day you will get to live Improvement

Pill's life and one day I will get to live 
yours. Or maybe that's already happened.

Now why am I bringing up this crazy idea that 
I certainly can't prove. Well as I've played

with this idea in my head for the past couple of 
months, I've started to actually believe it. Not

a lot, maybe only like 10%. But it's brought 
some very interesting benefits into my life.

First of all I don't really feel negative 
emotions as strongly. Sometimes I'll be

on social media looking at someone who is way 
more successful than I am, more talented, more

attractive - and in the past I might have felt 
some form of envy or feel bad about myself – but

nowadays with this new belief that we are all the 
same – my thinking changes - I start to think,

“Wow that's cool, I'm glad that version of 
me gets to live that life. Good for them”

Secondly, I feel more connected with 
people who are experiencing hardship.

Sometimes I come across panhandlers when I travel 
and I end up thinking “wow that's going to be me

one day. I'm going to experience this form 
of hardship as well. I should help em out.”

Now - this is a very different from how I used to 
think when I was younger. Back then I felt proud

when I donated money. I would think wow, I'm sure 
people watching think that I'm such a good person.

But with this new belief - I don't really feel 
proud, I feel like I'm taking care of a wound

on my own body. That's the best way to describe 
it. Like it's my duty to take care of myself.

And finally this belief has made me more 
understanding. We often witch-hunt people

on social media. “This person is 
evil because they did x y and z.”

When I see these people being 
accused - I think “wow that's me

in another life” If I was born in that 
body, in that environment, and had to live

their life – I would probably do the equally 
messed up thing that they've been accused of.

I can also be terrible. So I don't get angry 
or upset when I see people in this situation.

I actually feel curious as to what led them down 
this path. And if the accusations are even true.

Now look – I know I've been away for a while – 
and I know this idea sounds crazy. But I wanted

to share it with you because it is something 
that I think about a lot nowadays – and it's

honestly made me happier. I hope it brings you 
the same sort of peace that it's brought me.
